title: Ferne McCann details her 'embarrassing' incontinence battle on Loose Women with daughter Sunday
text:
Ferne McCann detailed her 'embarrassing' incontinence battle as her daughter Sunday, 23 months, made her Loose Women debut on Wednesday's edition of the talk show.

The media personality, 29, admitted she didn't think she'd be experiencing the problem in her late 20s as she 'associated it with the elderly' and is currently 'in my prime'.

In a bid to raise awareness on how to help treat incontinence, the TV star practised pelvic floor exercises with panellists Coleen Nolan, Brenda Edwards, Jane Moore and Ayda Field as she discussed motherhood, dating and the upcoming fourth season of First Time Mum.

With her cherubic daughter on her lap, Ferne shared: 'It’s something I associated with the elderly, I’m 29 now and I feel like I’m in my prime and this isn’t something I thought I should be going through.'

WHAT IS URINARY INCONTINENCE? Urinary incontinence is the loss of bladder control. It affects up to six million people in the UK and 17 million in the US to some extent. Some sufferers occasionally leak urine when they sneeze or cough, whereas others get urges that are so sudden they do not get to the toilet in time. It is more common with age and can occur due to conditions such as arthritis if patients cannot undo their trouser buttons quickly enough. Other causes may include a urinary tract infection, pregnancy, childbirth, menopause, a hysterectomy and prostate cancer. Alcohol, caffeine, carbonated drinks and spicy foods can stimulate the bladder, making symptoms worse. Sufferers should seek help from their GP as urinary incontinence can indicate a more serious underlying condition. It can also restrict people's everyday activities and increase their risk of falls if they rush to the bathroom. People can reduce their risk by maintaining a healthy weight, eating lots of fibre, practicing pelvic floor exercises and not smoking. Source: Mayo Clinic

Sufferers can improve their symptoms by cutting down on caffeine and alcohol, bladder training and pelvic floor exercises.

'A lot of people don’t know how to do it, it’s essentially stopping yourself from passing urine basically', the blonde beauty explained, while strengthening her pelvic floor muscles with the panel.

Aside from her health woes, the former hairdresser was in great spirits as she joined her child Sunday, and revealed she reached out to the public for help when the toddler went through a biting stage.

The doting mother said: 'I actually turned to the public, I love turning to them because I’m just like any mother.

'Obviously we get to go to red carpet events so there is a glitzy glamorous sides... I turned to the public and ask them how they deal with it.'

Reflecting on how she's adjusted to life as a single mother, Ferne - who shares Sunday with jailed ex Arthur Collins - explained: 'I actually had no expectations about motherhood I wasn’t overly maternal before I fell pregnant.

'I kind of took everything in my stride and that’s what the show portrays, it was a real challenge. it's like as it happened, there’s no self-editing, its fly on the wall warts and all.'

The I'm A Celeb star shared her delight over the latest series of her reality show First Time Mum, which debuts on ITVBe on Wednesday.

She explained: 'I can’t believe it series four, the first series followed my pregnancy, then learning to be a mum and now toddler. She’s two on Saturday.'

Ferne also touched on whether she'll have more children and experiencing 'mum guilt' whenever she fulfills her work duties.

She said: 'I think every mum suffers with mum guilt. especially because I had no choice going back to work I had to go back to work being a single parent being her only provider.

'I'm learning to be a mum to a toddler': The I'm A Celeb star shared her delight over the latest series of her reality show First Time Mum, which debuts on ITVBe on Wednesday

'You feel so turn between work, and am I don’t the right thing... sometimes I feel like I spend too much time looking at my phone and I look up and think oh no.

'I would love to have more children... when I gave birth to Sunday and people asked so will you have more and I thought “whoa, let me have this one first”.

'She’s two on Saturday and I’d love to extend and grow the family, definitely. I can’t get there on my own. I definitely need a man first, it is so tough dating.'

The former This Morning showbiz correspondent has been single since she split from Sunday's father Arthur in early 2017, but recently enjoyed a brief fling with Love Island star Jordan Hames.

In good company: Following her lunchtime TV appearance, the Essex beauty cradled her daughter as they left the ITV studios

Having fun: The blonde looked typically stunning in a semi-sheer navy dress, paired with nude fringed boots

On her 'difficult' dating life, Ferne shared: 'Being in the public eye is weird, I can’t even going on a date without it getting in the press.

'Believe it or not, this is me before I had a child, I’m very much like right should I get married. Even on a night out with the girls, I have to get planning and have a baby sitter. It’s very difficult to go on a date.'

Essex beauty Ferne also revealed she's set to move out of her flat and settle into her new house in the coming months.

She said: 'Well, at the moment I’m still in my flat and its pretty much on one level, but shortly I’m moving to a house and it'll have stairs - which I'm slightly apprehensive and nervous.'
